perturbation.original_text: Section 12.07. Waiver of Jury Trial. THE PARTIES HERETO HEREBY IRREVOCABLY WAIVE ------ -- ---- ----- ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY OR THEREBY.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 12.07. Waiver of Jury Trial. THE PARTIES HERETO WAIVE ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY OR THEREBY.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the word 'irrevocably', the waiver of jury trial becomes potentially revocable. This introduces a legal risk because, under Ontario law (specified in Section 12.06), waivers must be clear and unequivocal. Making the waiver revocable could render it unenforceable, contradicting the intention of the clause and potentially violating the standard of clear consent required for such waivers.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The change affects the interpretation and enforceability of the waiver of jury trial under Ontario law, which requires clear and unequivocal waivers.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6.12. Restraint on Claims. Each Grantor undertakes not to assert any -------------------- claim for Patent infringement with respect to use and maintenance of Licensed Products against any end user, customer or distributor of Grantee, or any subsequent vendee, lessee, or transferee to the extent the Licensed Products have been acquired from Grantee after the Effective Date and are used for the purpose for which they predominantly have been made (without modification or amendment).
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6.12. Restraint on Claims. Each Grantor undertakes not to assert any claim for Patent infringement with respect to use and maintenance of Licensed Products against any end user, customer or distributor of Grantee, or any subsequent vendee, lessee, or transferee.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'to the extent the Licensed Products have been acquired from Grantee after the Effective Date and are used for the purpose for which they predominantly have been made (without modification or amendment)' has been removed. The intent of this phrase is to outline parameters in which the Grantor is not allowed to assert any claim for patent infringement. By removing that statement, the Grantor now has more freedom to assert claims of patent infringement, which may violate the implied warranty of non-infringement that is generally included in software license agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The change limits implied warranty of non-infringement.

perturbation.original_text: Section 11.03. Limitation on Types of Damages. perturbation.changed_text: Section 11.03. Limitation on Types of Damages. In no event shall either Party be liable to the other Party for any indirect, incidental and/or consequential damages resulting from a breach of this agreement. In no event shall either Party be liable for any special or punitive damages arising from breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'Except for breach of Article VIII and for Article XII, including without limitation lost business, lost savings, and lost profits even if the breaching Party has been advised of the possibility of the occurrence of such damages' we are contradicting Ontario law. Under Ontario law, there are some statutory causes of action where consequential damages cannot be waived. This also goes against the reasonable expectation of both Parties involved.
